name: The Pantheon

name: The Potala Palace
uniques: Must have an owned [Mountain] within [2] tiles
quote: 'The first time I stepped onto the rooftop of the Potala Palace, I felt, as never before or since, as if I were stepping onto the rooftop of my being: onto some dimension of consciousness that I’d never visited before.' - Pico Iyer

name: St. Peter Basilica
uniqueText: Gain a free [Cathedral] in this city
[+2 Faith] <after adopting [Piety] and [All] it's Policy's Branches>
quote: 'From the dome of St. Peter's one can see every notable object in Rome... He can see a panorama that is varied, extensive, beautiful to the eye, and more illustrious in history than any other in Europe.' - Mark Twain

name: Abu Simbel
uniques: Must have an owned [Mountain] within [2] tiles
quote: 'My name is Ozymandias, king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!' - Percy Bysshe Shelley

name: Bolshoi Theatre
quote: 'Bolshoi Ballet is a universe of the imagination, a place of magic and enchantment, beauty and romance. Its many worlds vibrate with graceful dancers, glorious music, and sumptuous costumes.' - Trudy Garfunkel

name: Mont St.Michel
uniques: All newly-trained [Missionary] units [in this city] receive the [Devout] promotion
quote: 'Church and State, Soul and Body, God and Man, are all one at Mont Saint Michel, and the business of all is to fight, each in his own way, or to stand guard for each other.' - Henry Adams

name: St. Catherine Monastery
uniques: Must have an owned [Mountain] within [2] tiles
quote: 'The only place where one can go to experience the presence of God is Mount Sinai: here is where Moses received the tablets of the law, here is where the cloud rested on the Mount, here is where the fire spoke and the God of Israel was heard talking to Moses; the entire history of Israel begins at Sinai; if we seek to find God here in Sinai, what are we looking for? What we seek is the same God that Moses met on top of this mountain in the fire and the cloud. We are looking for the same God that spoke to Moses, the same God that led the people of Israel through the Red Sea and to the other side of the Jordan.' - Hans Küng
